trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Upgrade from a previous version | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Upgrade from a previous version | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains the different methods to upgrade to the latest release of Azure Active Direcotry Connect, including in-place upgrade and swing migration.
trans-unit.target: Explains the different methods to upgrade to the latest release of Azure Active Direcotry Connect, including in-place upgrade and swing migration.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Upgrade from a previous version to the latest
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Upgrade from a previous version to the latest

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the different methods you can use to upgrade your Azure AD Connect installation to the latest release.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the different methods you can use to upgrade your Azure AD Connect installation to the latest release.

trans-unit.source: We recommendation that you keep current with the releases of Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: We recommendation that you keep current with the releases of Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: If you want to upgrade from DirSync, see [Upgrade from Azure AD sync tool (DirSync)](active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started.md) instead.
trans-unit.target: If you want to upgrade from DirSync, see [Upgrade from Azure AD sync tool (DirSync)](active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started.md) instead.

trans-unit.source: There are a few different strategies to upgrade Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: There are a few different strategies to upgrade Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Automatic upgrade
trans-unit.target: Automatic upgrade

trans-unit.source: For customers with an express installation, this is the easiest method.
trans-unit.target: For customers with an express installation, this is the easiest method.

trans-unit.source: In-place upgrade
trans-unit.target: In-place upgrade

trans-unit.source: If you have a single server, upgrade the installation in-place on the same server.
trans-unit.target: If you have a single server, upgrade the installation in-place on the same server.

trans-unit.source: Swing migration
trans-unit.target: Swing migration

trans-unit.source: With two servers, you can prepare one of the servers with the new release and change active server when you are ready.
trans-unit.target: With two servers, you can prepare one of the servers with the new release and change active server when you are ready.

trans-unit.source: For required permissions, see [permissions required for upgrade](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md#upgrade).
trans-unit.target: For required permissions, see [permissions required for upgrade](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md#upgrade).

trans-unit.source: In-place upgrade
trans-unit.target: In-place upgrade

trans-unit.source: An in-place upgrade will work for moving from Azure AD Sync or Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: An in-place upgrade will work for moving from Azure AD Sync or Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: It will not work for DirSync or for a solution with FIM + Azure AD Connector.
trans-unit.target: It will not work for DirSync or for a solution with FIM + Azure AD Connector.

trans-unit.source: This method is preferred if you have a single server and less than about 100,000 objects.
trans-unit.target: This method is preferred if you have a single server and less than about 100,000 objects.

trans-unit.source: After the upgrade, a full import and full synchronization will occur.
trans-unit.target: After the upgrade, a full import and full synchronization will occur.

trans-unit.source: This will ensure that the new configuration will be applied to all existing objects in the system.
trans-unit.target: This will ensure that the new configuration will be applied to all existing objects in the system.

trans-unit.source: This might take a few hours depending on the number of objects in scope of the sync engine.
trans-unit.target: This might take a few hours depending on the number of objects in scope of the sync engine.

trans-unit.source: The normal delta synchronization scheduled, by default every 30 minutes, is suspended but password synchronization will continue.
trans-unit.target: The normal delta synchronization scheduled, by default every 30 minutes, is suspended but password synchronization will continue.

trans-unit.source: You might consider to do the in-place upgrade during a weekend.
trans-unit.target: You might consider to do the in-place upgrade during a weekend.

trans-unit.source: In-Place Upgrade
trans-unit.target: In-Place Upgrade

trans-unit.source: If you have made changes to out-of-box synchronization rules, these will be set back to default configuration on upgrade.
trans-unit.target: If you have made changes to out-of-box synchronization rules, these will be set back to default configuration on upgrade.

trans-unit.source: To make sure your configuration is kept between upgrades, make sure the changes are made as described in [Best practices for changing the default configuration](active-directory-aadconnectsync-best-practices-changing-default-configuration.md).
trans-unit.target: To make sure your configuration is kept between upgrades, make sure the changes are made as described in [Best practices for changing the default configuration](active-directory-aadconnectsync-best-practices-changing-default-configuration.md).

trans-unit.source: Swing migration
trans-unit.target: Swing migration

trans-unit.source: If you have a complex deployment or very many objects, it might be impractical to do an in-place upgrade on the live system.
trans-unit.target: If you have a complex deployment or very many objects, it might be impractical to do an in-place upgrade on the live system.

trans-unit.source: This could for some customers take multiple days and during this time no delta changes will be processed.
trans-unit.target: This could for some customers take multiple days and during this time no delta changes will be processed.

trans-unit.source: Instead the recommended method to use is a swing migration.
trans-unit.target: Instead the recommended method to use is a swing migration.

trans-unit.source: For this method you will need (at least) two servers, one active and one staging server.
trans-unit.target: For this method you will need (at least) two servers, one active and one staging server.

trans-unit.source: The active server (solid blue lines in the picture below) will be responsible for the active load.
trans-unit.target: The active server (solid blue lines in the picture below) will be responsible for the active load.

trans-unit.source: The staging server (dashed purple lines in the picture below) will be prepared with the new release and when fully ready, this server will be made active.
trans-unit.target: The staging server (dashed purple lines in the picture below) will be prepared with the new release and when fully ready, this server will be made active.

trans-unit.source: The previous active server, now with the old version installed, will be made the staging server and upgraded.
trans-unit.target: The previous active server, now with the old version installed, will be made the staging server and upgraded.

trans-unit.source: Staging server
trans-unit.target: Staging server

trans-unit.source: Note: It has been noted that some customers prefer to have three or four servers for this.
trans-unit.target: Note: It has been noted that some customers prefer to have three or four servers for this.

trans-unit.source: Since the staging server is being upgrades, you will during this time not have a backup server in case of a [disaster recovery](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#disaster-recovery).
trans-unit.target: Since the staging server is being upgrades, you will during this time not have a backup server in case of a [disaster recovery](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#disaster-recovery).

trans-unit.source: With a maximum of four servers, a new set of primary/standby servers with the new version can be prepared, ensuring there are always a staging server ready to take over.
trans-unit.target: With a maximum of four servers, a new set of primary/standby servers with the new version can be prepared, ensuring there are always a staging server ready to take over.

trans-unit.source: These steps will also work to move from Azure AD Sync or a solution with FIM + Azure AD Connector.
trans-unit.target: These steps will also work to move from Azure AD Sync or a solution with FIM + Azure AD Connector.

trans-unit.source: These steps will not work for DirSync, but the same swing migration (also called parallel deployment) method with steps for DirSync can be found in [Upgrade Azure Active Directory sync (DirSync)](active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: These steps will not work for DirSync, but the same swing migration (also called parallel deployment) method with steps for DirSync can be found in [Upgrade Azure Active Directory sync (DirSync)](active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Swing migration steps
trans-unit.target: Swing migration steps

trans-unit.source: Make sure your active server and staging server are both using the same version.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your active server and staging server are both using the same version.

trans-unit.source: If you have made some custom configuration and your staging server does not have it, follow the steps under [Move custom configuration from active to staging server](#move-custom-configuration-from-active-to-staging-server).
trans-unit.target: If you have made some custom configuration and your staging server does not have it, follow the steps under [Move custom configuration from active to staging server](#move-custom-configuration-from-active-to-staging-server).

trans-unit.source: Upgrade the staging server to the latest version.
trans-unit.target: Upgrade the staging server to the latest version.

trans-unit.source: Let the sync engine run full import and full synchronization.
trans-unit.target: Let the sync engine run full import and full synchronization.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the new configuration did not cause any unexpected changes using the steps under **Verify** in [Verify the configuration of a server](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#verify-the-configuration-of-a-server).
trans-unit.target: Verify that the new configuration did not cause any unexpected changes using the steps under **Verify** in [Verify the configuration of a server](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#verify-the-configuration-of-a-server).

trans-unit.source: If something is not as expected, correct, run import and sync, and verify until the data looks good.
trans-unit.target: If something is not as expected, correct, run import and sync, and verify until the data looks good.

trans-unit.source: These steps can be found in the linked topic.
trans-unit.target: These steps can be found in the linked topic.

trans-unit.source: Switch the staging server to be the active server.
trans-unit.target: Switch the staging server to be the active server.

trans-unit.source: This is the final step **switch active server** in [Verify the configuration of a server](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#verify-the-configuration-of-a-server).
trans-unit.target: This is the final step **switch active server** in [Verify the configuration of a server](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#verify-the-configuration-of-a-server).

trans-unit.source: Upgrade the server now in staging mode to the latest release.
trans-unit.target: Upgrade the server now in staging mode to the latest release.

trans-unit.source: Follow the same steps as before to get the data and configuration upgraded.
trans-unit.target: Follow the same steps as before to get the data and configuration upgraded.

trans-unit.source: Move custom configuration from active to staging server
trans-unit.target: Move custom configuration from active to staging server

trans-unit.source: If you have made configuration changes to the active server, you need to make sure the same changes are applied to the staging server.
trans-unit.target: If you have made configuration changes to the active server, you need to make sure the same changes are applied to the staging server.

trans-unit.source: The custom sync rules you have created can be moved with PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The custom sync rules you have created can be moved with PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Other changes must be applied the same way on both systems.
trans-unit.target: Other changes must be applied the same way on both systems.

trans-unit.source: Thing you must make sure is configured the same way on both servers:
trans-unit.target: Thing you must make sure is configured the same way on both servers:

trans-unit.source: Connection to the same forests.
trans-unit.target: Connection to the same forests.

trans-unit.source: Any Domain and OU filtering.
trans-unit.target: Any Domain and OU filtering.

trans-unit.source: The same optional features, such as password sync and password writeback.
trans-unit.target: The same optional features, such as password sync and password writeback.

trans-unit.source: Move synchronization rules
trans-unit.target: Move synchronization rules

trans-unit.source: To move a custom synchronization rule, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To move a custom synchronization rule, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Open **Synchronization Rules Editor** on your active server.
trans-unit.target: Open **Synchronization Rules Editor** on your active server.

trans-unit.source: Select your custom rule.
trans-unit.target: Select your custom rule.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Export**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Export**.

trans-unit.source: This will bring up a notepad window.
trans-unit.target: This will bring up a notepad window.

trans-unit.source: Save the temporary file with a PS1 extension; this will make it a PowerShell script.
trans-unit.target: Save the temporary file with a PS1 extension; this will make it a PowerShell script.

trans-unit.source: Copy the ps1 file to the staging server.
trans-unit.target: Copy the ps1 file to the staging server.

trans-unit.source: ![Sync Rule Export](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-upgrade-previous-version/exportrule.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Sync Rule Export](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-upgrade-previous-version/exportrule.png)

trans-unit.source: The Connector GUID will be different on the staging server.
trans-unit.target: The Connector GUID will be different on the staging server.

trans-unit.source: To get the GUID, start the **Synchronization Rules Editor**, select one of the out-of-box rules representing the same connected system, and click on **Export**.
trans-unit.target: To get the GUID, start the **Synchronization Rules Editor**, select one of the out-of-box rules representing the same connected system, and click on **Export**.

trans-unit.source: Replace the GUID in your PS1 file with the GUID from the staging server.
trans-unit.target: Replace the GUID in your PS1 file with the GUID from the staging server.

trans-unit.source: In a PowerShell prompt, run the PS1 file.
trans-unit.target: In a PowerShell prompt, run the PS1 file.

trans-unit.source: This will create the custom synchronization rule on the staging server.
trans-unit.target: This will create the custom synchronization rule on the staging server.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple custom rules, repeat for all custom rules.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple custom rules, repeat for all custom rules.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
